browsermonkey.document
Class Document

java.lang.Object
  browsermonkey.document.Document

public class Document
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a document attached to a path, contains the parsed form of the document as a DocumentNode tree.

Constructor Summary
Document(java.lang.String path, java.net.URL context)
          Constructs a new Document with the specified path.
 
Method Summary
 int getError()
          Returns the error status code of this document.
 browsermonkey.document.DocumentNode getNodeTree()
          Returns the DocumentNode tree for this document.
 java.net.URL getURL()
          Returns the URL of the current document
 boolean isConformant()
          Returns true if the document is conformant to the html standards.
 void load()
          Opens the file specified by this Document's path and parses it, generating the DocumentNode tree.
 void loadTest(java.lang.String tagText)
          Load testing method, use the tagText variable to select which load test to use.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Returns true if the document is conformant to the html standards.

Returns:

public int getError()
Returns the error status code of this document.

Returns:
0 if loaded, otherwise the error code (e.g. 404)

Load testing method, use the tagText variable to select which load test to use.

Parameters:
